Nightlight/kup::

Nightlight stopped and  and leaned to a wall, images started to spin inside 
her head: the ones as predacon, when Rodimus was totured and she was forced 
to watch, her own imprisoment, the care that she had in Perceptor's and 
Rodimus's hand. She tried to contain all those images for her sanity's sake; 
Others started to pup up: a baby in her arms, herself surrounded by 
Predacons, when she was a predacon named Blackstorm, a smiling child running 
around her, the mistreat that she suffered in Jhiaxus's hand and when 
Rodimus's beaten her following hydras's commands.

She didnt know who really was. She started to feel tired, unexplained tired, 
as if she handt slept in several days. she had to hold a piper in order to 
avoid fell but he couldnt be stand up for so long. A chorus of voices arouse 
in her head while her vision became blurry. She couldnt fight that feeling 
for so long.


*************

Kup emerged from a corritor holding his dart gun looking to Nightlight and 
later to Rodimus said in low voice "Forgive me... i beg your fogiveness but 
i cant let her escape... Time is  short... She will sleep a while... we can 
reprogram her... and then she will understand all... "

Then the old autobot opened his comlink and said "Here is Kup"said while he 
started to track Nightshift's signature and move towards the autobot"I beg 
your pardon Tucson and I'll take the punishmet that I deserve to disobey 
your commands. I felt obliged to help Rodimus to rescue Nightlgiht, she 
attemped to escape and I... I did what I have to do"said the old autobot




--------------------------------------------------
From: "Preston Carroll" <supercyclonus@...>
Sent: Friday, April 23, 2010 11:23 AM
To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
Subject: Re: The Light of the Flame!

> Who: RODIMUS PRIME, Kup, Nightlight
> Location: Black Fortress - Hallways
>
>> Nightlight smiled with relief, it was Rodimus.
>>
>> "i'm here"said the female while she left her hide out"i tried to reach 
>> the
>> throne room... I"
>>
>> She Gasped, she saw the autobot's symbol in Rodimus's chest, she felt
>> surpriced and betrayed. Tears started to fell down, she loved him but he
>> betrayed her faction; everithing that he told were lies. She just liked 
>> to
>> move a way there, and ran, without realize towards the cell block area.
>
> As Nightlight ran Rodimus quickly shifted into vehicular mode again
> and drove after her, using his superior speed to hopefully over take
> her.
>
> "Nightlight!" he said, calling her by the only name that he has ever
> known her by. "It is still me Rodimus, the one who has sworn on his
> life to protect you from all harm!" Rodimus tried to swerve on front
> of and transformed again.
>
> "It's me! Don't you still trust me?" He said, pain obvious in his
> voice, pain from her dismissal of him, of her fear of him. "I remember
> it all!" he said, his voice taking on a note of urgencey as he spoke,
> "I know who you were, and who you are, and most importantly who we are
> and what we meant to each other." His words spilling over with
> conviction as he talked.
>
> He gestured to her as if he would embrace her in a hug if she would
> let him, "I have come to fulfill a promise that I made to you not only
> earlier but the one I made to years ago, that you and I would always
> be one spark, and that nothing would harm you as long as I lived."
>
> Rodimus' head lights brightened, "And there is another that would want
> you to remember as well." A small image began to appear in the midst
> of Rodimus headlights as a viewscreen appeared. In it was a picture of
> a young female Autobot: Elita.
>
> As Rodimus spoke chatter from the other Autobots could be heard . . .
>
>> " This is Tucson Prime, I copy you Rodimus Prime. Although your words are 
>> encouraging, I must say I meet them with a bit of apprehension myself. I 
>> will do everything in my power to keep the peace among us, but do keep in 
>> mind, trust will be the most difficult thing to gain among our faction. 
>> You have turned against us in the past, served our enemy faithfully, and 
>> for that, many of us are leary of your return to our side. You show a 
>> vulnerability to be easilly swayed and in order to regain your status 
>> among us, you must prove you can overcome this vulnerability. So it is 
>> with this in mind, that I request you pass a test of loyalty toward our 
>> faction. A test that only I can adiminister, and a test only I can deem 
>> you worthy of passing. And until such time that I have deemed you worthy 
>> of this task, leadership of the Autobots will be diverted to me, and none 
>> of my orders are to be disobeyed. Do I have your word and compliance 
>> Rodimus Prime?"
>
> "I copy you as well Tuscon." Rodimus' voice came over the transmission
> lines, that new sense of conviction transitting loud and clear across
> it. "We all have our tests to pass and fail and I have failed mine,
> but it is not just you or your worthiness that I have to live up but
> all the Autobots and the matrix itself."
>
> Rodimus paused as he looked at Nightlight wanting her to hear the
> words he spoke to. "Inside of all of us is a darkness and weakness and
> fear, any of which can be exploited if one finds the right key, the
> right leverage. To deny it is to forget that we are living beings. We
> all have to focus and remember who we are and where we stand. I had
> forgotten that, but I shall not forget it again."
>
> Rodimus smiled at Nightlight, that smile also carried into his voice
> as he spoke, "Sometimes it is not our successes that teach us, but our
> failures. Tuscon, you have led the Autobots well in my absence, and
> you will continue to do so I have no doubt. There is too much that
> stands between me and any command right now."
>
> "However I caution you, the mantle of the command weighs heavy on the
> head of those who bear it."
>
> Rodimus looked at Nightlight as he wondered what she would do.
>
> (TAG)
